post.title: President Trump to ban TikTok from the US today

body:
Feels like some of you failed at critical thinking. Facebook collects the same data as tiktok which they've been selling to Chinese companies including Huawei, but for some reason Trump isn't looking to ban Facebook. When other companies are accused of overstepping their bounds on privacy we drag their CEO in front of congress to explain themselves, but for some reason Trump is going right for a ban. Hrm, I wonder why.

The really stupid part is some of you are so spooked by China that you're willfully accepting and supporting a "great US firewall" to block content. You know, like the one in China. It seems "China" is to conservatives what "racist" is to libtards. Just spooky words that are used to instill a panic and gain support.

body:
Oh right, I thought that because you said "Feels like some of you failed at critical thinking" that you were referring to the cognitive dissonance that people experience when they think that only TikTok should be banned. 

I think the reason Trump is only banning TikTok at this moment is that it is much easier to ban foreign companies than it is to ban american ones. I hope that this is only the first step, and that he eventually tackles the companies that are much harder to take on.

I suppose that's possible, but it's also possible he didn't care about tiktok until the zoomers made him look like a fool by fucking with his rallies. Since I grew up in Atlantic City, and I've been following his actions for the past 30 years, and I know damn well he's a narcissist, I'm going to assume the latter.

Don't get me wrong. As presents go he's not terrible, but he does use his office to handle personal vendettas. Unlike previous presidents except for maybe Nixon.

body: A ban on selling data to Chinese companies would be interesting but about as futile as banning the selling arms to nations we've blacklisted. (Hint: They still get US arms.) Those types of bans only hurt small companies who -- unlike multi nationlists companies -- don't have the means and resources to get around them. Admittedly, we can't throw our hands up in the air and say, "Oh well, no point in trying." But I'm not convinced China is the boogeyman they're being made out to be.
body_html: A ban on selling data to Chinese companies would be interesting but about as futile as banning the selling arms to nations we've blacklisted. (Hint: They still get US arms.) Those types of bans only hurt small companies who -- unlike multi nationlists companies -- don't have the means and resources to get around them. Admittedly, we can't throw our hands up in the air and say, "Oh well, no point in trying." But I'm not convinced China is the boogeyman they're being made out to be.

body:
Donald Trump's rally in Oklahoma had inflated numbers because of TikTok. That fact is true, but it did not affect his rally as bad as it looked at first glance. There were BLM protesters outside of the stadium that threatened Trump supporters as they attempted to enter the stadium. Security had to limit the amount of people they could let in. It is possible that Donald Trump was made aware of TikTok because of the rally, but it may have not been a vendetta. He has certainly had other vendettas though.

President Bush's vendetta against Iraq is well documented, as well as like you said Nixon. There are possibly even vendettas that hadn't been reported by the press, or had just simply been forgotten about. 

I have lived in New Jersey my whole life, so I have also known about Trump for a long time. I don't think that he is a perfect person, nor president. I do however think that he is doing way better than Hillary Clinton would, and I don't think Joe Biden would do any better,

body: Oh, Joe Biden is a joke lol I really hate this electoral system we set ourselves up with, and I guess you're right. Bush Jr going into Iraq was one of the biggest vendettas in recent history.
body_html: Oh, Joe Biden is a joke lol I really hate this electoral system we set ourselves up with, and I guess you're right. Bush Jr going into Iraq was one of the biggest vendettas in recent history.

parent.body:
Donald Trump's rally in Oklahoma had inflated numbers because of TikTok. That fact is true, but it did not affect his rally as bad as it looked at first glance. There were BLM protesters outside of the stadium that threatened Trump supporters as they attempted to enter the stadium. Security had to limit the amount of people they could let in. It is possible that Donald Trump was made aware of TikTok because of the rally, but it may have not been a vendetta. He has certainly had other vendettas though.

President Bush's vendetta against Iraq is well documented, as well as like you said Nixon. There are possibly even vendettas that hadn't been reported by the press, or had just simply been forgotten about. 

I have lived in New Jersey my whole life, so I have also known about Trump for a long time. I don't think that he is a perfect person, nor president. I do however think that he is doing way better than Hillary Clinton would, and I don't think Joe Biden would do any better,

body:
When education and media are so saturated with hyper amped up far left ideology, there's no point in being civil discussions. It has no place. You burned all the public discussion forums to the ground, so don't cry when people resort to means other than politics.
For what is worth, I didn't ever buy into Trump, but I do enjoy how much angst he causes in the establishment powers.

all idiots.

post.title: President Trump to ban TikTok from the US today

body:
I don't like Trump, mostly due to his "lAw AnD oRdEr" attitude and poor COVID leadership, but I think his actions toward China will keep us *out* of a war. 

Tik-Tok isn't the only popular software that spies on its users, but it's only one beholden to a malicious foreign power. Fuck Tik-Tok and fuck the CCP.

I can't believe you're buying that load of shit about national security lol

What does lying to get the US into a war have to do with being a crybaby?

post.title: President Trump to ban TikTok from the US today

body:
Welp, I pretty much disagree with everything you said. First, we've stayed out of war with China due to economic interdependency, which is why Trump's trade war with China is dangerous. Second, China already has a significant stake in America. Both in terms of China carrying $1T of our debt, and China spending over $100B a year acquiring companies. Finally, I don't get the fuck the CCP mentality, as if China is significantly worse than the US.

Our lives are already surrounded by Chinese made technology that's spying on us, and Trump think banning an app used by tweans is meaningful? Give me a break.

post.title: President Trump to ban TikTok from the US today

body:
I see what you're saying with respect to economic interdependence, but that is the neoliberal track that led us here in the first place. 

China's leadership doesn't adhere to the international standards that allow them to play the trade game with the rest of us. They've lied, cheated, and stolen their way to their current station and the behavior they've engaged in on the international stage cannot go on forever. If it does, it likely would lead to some sort of kinetic engagement down the road. In fact, in some places it already has.

Since the CCP loves animal analogies: they are like an angry dog being held back by the ears. The longer we hold them back, the harder they will bite when we inevitably let go. Obama initially recognized the threat, and now Trump has taken the steps to let them go at a point when we can still engage them with soft power.

As far as the US's behavior is concerned, I agree that we have some pretty major issues that need to be addressed. Still, I won't engage in that sort of whataboutism here, as it's neither relevant nor helpful.

As far as the US's behavior is concerned, I agree that we have some pretty major issues that need to be addressed. Still, I won't engage in that sort of whataboutism here, as it's neither relevant nor helpful.

post.title: President Trump to ban TikTok from the US today

body:
Fair enough. Obviously the people in DC know more about the threats posed by China than I do. That being said, I'm sure half our concern is maintaining dominance across the globe. We're the thief breaking in to steal a TV getting mad when another thief crawls through the window. While I wouldn't want family members going with less because we're not being assertive with nations around the world, I just don't have any fuck you feelings towards China. Don't hate the player, hate the game.

I also don't want to become more like them by censoring the internet in order to combat them. If people out there feel so strongly about certain American values (2A) that they're willing accept a school shooting here there, then I'm willing to accept a little spying to maintain my American values (1A).
